task_summary: Robot arm locates and picks up a tennis ball from a table using visual perception and side grasp.

task_long_description.overview: This episode features a blue robot arm picking up a tennis ball located centrally on a small table. The workspace contains distractor objects nearby. The robotic sequence involves visual search, approach, verification, gentle grasp, and lift of the target tennis ball, prioritizing low force and reliable object acquisition with visual confirmation before execution.
preconditions: Robot arm powered and functioning normally
Workspace clear except for known objects
Tennis ball present in reachable area
stepwise_plan: Check tennis ball visibility or scan to locate if not detected
Detect tennis ball and confirm with sensor
Move and position above tennis ball
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Close gripper with low force to grasp tennis ball
Verify tennis ball is secured (object in gripper)
success_criteria: Tennis ball grasped and held securely by gripper
No damage to tennis ball or hardware
failure_and_recovery: If tennis ball not found: perform scan again up to 3 retries
If grasp fails: open gripper, reposition and retry entire pick sequence
If grip unstable: reattempt approach and close cycle
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates after tennis ball is grasped and held by gripper, as validated by sensory feedback.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if tennis ball is currently visible to sensors
Scans workspace for tennis ball using raster pattern, up to 3 attempts
Detects tennis ball position using active perception
Moves gripper above tennis ball at 5cm offset
Computes grasp pose for tennis ball using side grasp strategy
Approaches and tightly aligns gripper with tennis ball
Lowers gripper until gentle contact detected with tennis ball
Closes gripper with minimum allowed force to gently grasp tennis ball
Verifies tennis ball is now held by gripper

failure_modes: Object not visible (tennis ball occluded, out of workspace)
Gripper failed to close or object not secured
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for visibility (up to 3 times)
Repeat full sequence if tennis ball not detected
Open gripper and realign for re-grasp if grasp fails
assumptions: Instruction matches visual evidence in all frames: tennis ball present, pick achievable
Side grasp selected based on execution observed in frames
No explicit 'place' action seen; episode ends after object is picked
Contact-sheet shows increasing phases without temporal regression

expected_success_criteria: Tennis ball held stably in gripper with minimum force
Robot arm avoids collision with furniture and other objects
